alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 26 at 8:52AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of DownEast Maine, including the following counties, Hancock and Washington. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Significant ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 850 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain on snowpack. This will continue to cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ellsworth, Bar Harbor, Bucksport, Blue Hill, Machias, Lubec, Eastport, Cherryfield, Deer Isle, Dedham, Jonesport, Castine, Steuben, Harrington, Perry, Pembroke, Jonesboro, Columbia Falls, Verona Island and Cutler. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
